comprehensive_overview: ResFinder is a web-based tool developed by the Center for Genomic Epidemiology for identification of acquired antimicrobial resistance genes in whole-genome sequencing data of bacterial isolates. It helps in predicting acquired antimicrobial resistance by comparing the input genome sequences to a set of known resistance genes.
core_features: Identification of acquired antimicrobial resistance genes
Comparison of input genome sequences to a database of known resistance genes
